name: boss-css-authoring
description: Boss CSS authoring conventions and style guidelines. Use when writing or reviewing $$ props, tokens, pseudos, @at, or className usage.

name: boss-css-tokens
description: Token authoring and usage. Use when defining tokens, consuming them in props/className, or overriding tokens at runtime.

name: boss-css-strategy
description: Guidance for choosing inline-first, classname-first, or runtime-only. Use when deciding strategy or troubleshooting output size/runtime.

name: boss-css-props
description: Finding the right Boss props and understanding custom non-CSS props. Use when unsure which prop to use or what shorthand exists.

name: boss-css-plugin-authoring
description: Creating Boss plugins and emitting metadata. Use when adding plugins or extending the prop pipeline.

name: boss-css-devserver-eval
description: Request client-side data via eval-client over the dev server. Use when you need runtime state or DOM data during local dev.

name: boss-css-classname
description: Classname syntax and shorthands. Use when writing className strings or converting from CSS.

name: boss-css-values
description: Preferred value forms (arrays, unitless numbers, shadows). Use when deciding how to express CSS values.

name: boss-css-breakpoints
description: Breakpoint and media shorthand guidance. Use when picking responsive keys or authoring at/mobile styles.

name: boss-css-bosswind
description: Bosswind shorthand preferences. Use when Bosswind is enabled and you want concise, Tailwind-like tokens.

name: boss-css-global-css
description: Global CSS usage via $$.css(). Use when you need global styles or arbitrary selectors.

name: boss-css-compile-pruning
description: How to keep compile output runtime-free. Use when you want compile to prune Boss runtime imports.

name: boss-css-compile
description: Boss compile usage and constraints. Use when running boss-css compile or deciding if compile is appropriate.

name: boss-css-runtime-only
description: Runtime-only strategy guidance. Use when enabling runtime.only or troubleshooting client-only CSS injection.

name: boss-css-classname-only
description: Classname-only mode guidance. Use when running classname-only strategy or migrating from utility classes.

name: boss-css-debugging
description: Debug logging and troubleshooting. Use when investigating Boss parsing, strategy, or CSS output issues.

name: boss-css-devtools
description: Devtools usage and dev server behavior. Use when enabling the devtools plugin or troubleshooting the socket.

name: boss-css-boundaries
description: CSS boundary rules and .boss.css behavior. Use when adjusting CSS scoping or boundary outputs.

name: boss-css-metadata
description: Emitting AI metadata from plugins. Use when you want LLMS sections or custom AI hints.
